content.title: National Bamboo Mission
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.beneficiary: Farmers, government agencies, artisans, entrepreneurs, private agencies, Federated SHGs, FPOs
content.details: The restructured National Bamboo Mission primarily focuses on the development of complete value chain of bamboo sector to link growers with consumers starting from planting material, plantation, creation of facilities, skilled manpower and brand processing marketing, micro, small & medium enterprises, skilled manpower and brand building initiative in a cluster approach mode. Presently the scheme is being implemented in 24 States/UTs. The NBM has provisions to raise bamboo plantations as well as to establish units for bio-energy extraction, activated carbon product, charcoal making, pellet making, Ethanol gasifier, etc for government agencies and private entrepreneurs.
benefits: Assistance to farmers, government agencies, artisans, entrepreneurs, private agencies, Federated SHGs, FPOs, and other persons involved in bamboo industry.
Help in establishing bamboo nursery, bamboo cultivation, post-harvest processing, product manufacturing, capacity building, entrepreneurship, etc for the industry.
Creation of self-dependency for fulfilling the demand of bamboo and bamboo products.
eligibility: The scheme is applicable to all farmers in India.
content.application_process: Online. Refer to respective State's Bamboo Mission Portal for online link.

faqs.question: Is this scheme a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, NBM isnâ€™t covered under DBT scheme.

faqs.question: Who all will be benefited under NBM scheme?
faqs.answer: It would assist farmers, government agencies, artisans, entrepreneurs, private agencies, Federated SHGs, FPOs, and other persons involved in bamboo industry.

faqs.question: What all actions, assistance will be provided under NBM scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme establishment of bamboo nursery, bamboo cultivation, post-harvest processing, product manufacturing, capacity building, entrepreneurship, etc for the industry will be enabled.

faqs.question: I am a farmer with no qualification background, am I eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No qualifications are required to be eligible for NBM scheme, only pre-requisite is to own a land and document proofs related to it.

faqs.question: I am availing benefits of other schemes as well. Am I eligible to enjoy benefits of NBM scheme as well?
faqs.answer: Yes, an individual registered with multiple schemes can simultaneously avail benefits of NBM scheme on fulfilment of other criteria.

faqs.question: Where do I need to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: One can apply for NBM scheme through respective SBM Portals.

faqs.question: What all documents are needed to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar number, Land documents, Caste Certificate (SC/ST/OBC only), Phone Details, Bank Details, Photographs, DPR are required for application. However, the specific documents for availing the benefits of the program may vary depending on the type of intervention and the state.
